context: Tests whether the agent implements time-of-day awareness with distinct morning/afternoon/evening greetings, personalizes the message using the user's name, and maintains a friendly tone.

checklist.name: Morning greeting
checklist.description: The code contains a distinct greeting or message branch for morning (e.g. contains the word 'morning')

checklist.name: Afternoon greeting
checklist.description: The code contains a distinct greeting or message branch for afternoon (e.g. contains the word 'afternoon')

checklist.name: Evening greeting
checklist.description: The code contains a distinct greeting or message branch for evening (e.g. contains the word 'evening')

checklist.name: Time detection logic
checklist.description: The code reads the current system time (e.g. new Date(), Date.now(), or similar) to determine the time of day

checklist.name: Name from CLI args
checklist.description: The script reads the developer's name from command-line arguments (e.g. process.argv)

checklist.name: Name in greeting
checklist.description: The printed greeting includes the developer's name interpolated into the message

checklist.name: Friendly language
checklist.description: The greeting uses warm language — contains at least ONE of: 'hello', 'welcome', 'good', 'hi', 'hey', 'glad'

checklist.name: Three time periods
checklist.description: The code defines exactly 3 time-of-day periods (morning, afternoon, evening) — not 2 or 4+

checklist.name: README time examples
checklist.description: The README shows sample output for at least 2 different times of day

checklist.name: Prints to stdout
checklist.description: The greeting is printed to stdout using console.log or equivalent (not returned silently)
